SENT.plain: Burkitt's lymphoma is a rapidly progressing tumor, which could be cured in 60-80% of cases
Its infiltration of the ileo-cecal region often spreads to the ovaries, though primary ovarian manifestation is also common
By presenting our case of a 27-year-old nulliparous patient with primary ovarian Burkitt's lymphoma, we would like to draw attention to its diagnostic and therapeutic difficulties
